revised_title: Inhibition of Hydrogen-Deuterium Exchange Reaction by Nitric Oxide and Propylene
tldr: The authors studied the effect of inhibitors, nitric oxide and propylene, on the hydrogen-deuterium exchange reaction. They found that both inhibitors reduced the reaction rate to the same limit, indicating that the residual reaction is almost entirely heterogeneous and the gas-phase reaction is suppressed. The results provide insights into the use of nitric oxide and olefines for inhibiting chain reactions.
